page.title: 02FARMING IN GOODLEIGH
page.content: The average farms have about 100-150 acres and are mainly stock farms speciaizing in sheep and cows. Sheep are useful for breeding lambs which are killed about 16 weeks old for human consumption or kept on the farm for future ewe replacements. Sheep are also useful for their wool. Most herds of cows are fed silage during the winter which is made by chopping summer grass into small lengths with a Forage Harvester and ensiling it in large clamps and leaving to fermemt until fed in the winter. Rearing bull calves for beef without castrating them is becoming another popular system.This method is called bull beef. They eat simi lar food to dairy cows such as silage,hay and cereals.
